10 Abbreviations: pre, middle, p ost = p osition of adverbial clause w.r.t. emb edding
clause, + = afinite construction, - = with overt auxiliary, s.l. = significance level, n.s.
= not significant.
10 Anne Breitbarth
e
starcke Hulff zugeschrieben [ ]
strong help to.written [have ]
`At closing this [issue of the newspaper] we receive the report that
the army of the States had a fierce battle with the Bohemian
knights and that the Bohemians have been overpowered; of more
than a hundred others however who had a go o d advantage, hardly
any survived [and] wrote from Bohemia to His Royal Ma jesty for
powerful help against such violence.'

tier.item: (23) Nach absterben des Olech/ hat Jgor sich gen Plesco
after death of.the Oleg has Igor himself into Plesco
genant OLHA/ vnd [ ] das Regiment
verheyrat zu ainer
and [has ] the government
married to someone cal led Olga
an die hand genumen/ vnd [ ] mit seinem Khriegsuolck
and [is ] with his army
in the hands taken
weitter verruckt/ biß gen Heracleam vnd Nicomediam khumen
further advanced until to Heraclea and Nicomedia come
[ ]/ darnach [ ] Er vberwunden worden/ vnd geflohen/ von
[is ] thereafter [is ] he defeated become and fled from
Maldito der Drewlianer Fuersten an dem ort Coresto
Maldito of.the Drew lian counts at the place Coresto
genant/ [ ] erschlagen/ vnd daselbsten begraben worden/
cal led [is ] kil led and there.self buried become
Pragmatic aspects of EMG auxiliary drop 13
`After Oleg had died, Igor married a woman from Plesco called
Olga, to ok power over the army and advanced further with his
soldiers until he reached Heraclea and Nicomedia; after that he
was overruled and he fled, he was killed by Maldito, the duke of
the Drewlians, and was buried in a place called Coresto.'13
(Herberstein (1557; 3r,02-06))

Pragmatic aspects of EMG auxiliary drop 13

After Oleg had died, Igor married a woman from Plesco called Olga, to ok power over the army and advanced further with his soldiers until he reached Heraclea and Nicomedia; after that he was overruled and he fled, he was killed by Maldito, the duke of the Drewlians, and was buried in a place called Coresto.'13
(Herberstein (1557; 3r,02-06))
